result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan Samuel Peterson

records.addlTxt:
3:35 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Nathan Samuel Peterson. Defendant Nathan Samuel Peterson in court, in custody. Atty. Dolfi states that a global offer has been received. Court notes several pending cases in Branch II and III. Court authorizes Branch III to resolve this case if there is a global resolution. Court sets STC. Adjourned: 3:38 PM. kma
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on November 18, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

9:34 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Jeremiah Harrelson in court for Nathan Samuel Peterson. Defendant Nathan Samuel Peterson in court. Atty. Harrelson states that there is a global resolution on all pending cases, requests additional time for resolution. ADA Ellenwood states that majority of other pending cases are in Branch 3. Kelli S. from JSC notes testing was suspended while DE was in treatment and questions treatment status. Atty. Harrelson states that DE graduated from in-patient treatment on 9/27. Court orders DE to check-in with JSC following court today and commence testing according to bond now that he is no longer in treatment. Adjourned: 9:36 AM. kma
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 11, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Felony Scheduling Order. Signed by SJN on 8/1/2022. c: DA and Atty via e-file. km

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Nicole Reder or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:37 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood and Intern Ali Casey in court for the State of Wisconsin, Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Nathan Samuel Peterson. Defendant Nathan Samuel Peterson appeared by video, in custody. DE qualifies for public defender.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. State requests bond. Atty. Dolfi makes bond argument. Court sets bond. Prelim time limits waived. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 1:40 PM. kma
Settlement conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Settlement conference on August 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
